item.description:
"In the Footsteps of Grace Metalious” Walking Tour

Tour guide - Robert B. Perreault

Sunday, June 3, 2012

1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m.

$10 general public, $5 Manchester Historic Association members

Children 12-18 half price & children under 12 free

Pre-registration is required by calling (603) 622-7531.

 

Local historian Robert B. Perreault will lead this tour of the neighborhood that Grace Derepentigny Metalious once called home. Metalious is the author of the novel Peyton Place, published in 1956. This book has had a major impact on popular American culture, and is still read and discussed today. The tour will include Central High School, Metalious' alma mater, as well as surrounding neighborhoods where there are several locations associated with her family, and that are featured in her autobiographical novel No Adam in Eden. The tour will begin at the corner of Bridge and Ash Streets.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet on the corner of Bridge & Ash Street (near former Ash Street School - 196 Bridge Street)
item.name: "In the Footsteps of Grace Metalious" Walking Tour
